WRITING.TEXT: From left to right: 1. Olight Warrior X 2. Surefire 6P Led with Vinh Nguyen warm hi-cri dropin 3. Surefire Z2 with Malkoff M61WL dropin 4. Surefire E2D incandescent 5. Surefire E2e incandescent 6. Surefire EDCL1-T 7. Surefire E1D Defender 8. Surefire E1B Backup (first gen) 9. HDS EDC Executive Nichia 219 custom mod 10. HDS EDC Executive Nichia 219 custom mod with black bezel amp; 'throwy' reflector
Yeah I've been addicted for a while... I am slimming down soon and selling a few!

Thank you. Yes I agree, their old stuff is awesome IMO! Especially the old P60 amp; E series hosts that you can bring up to modern specs with a huge selection of dropins and other accessories. I am upgrading both the E2e and E2D to LED soon along with 2-way clips, and a stainless steel bezel for the E2e..

This exact Z2 host I have was actually used by an American soldier in Iraq! (not me) Yeah they're definitely behind, but thanks to the modularity you can update them to modern specs. My one has a McClicky switch, black stainless steel bezel (to protect aluminium head) and a Malkoff M61wl dropin that mimics the incandescent look with a way longer runtime.
Thank you very much!
That's a very tough question!! If I could only keep one it would probably be one of the HDS EDC Executives... but I hope it won't ever just be one!
Fair enough!
I LOVE it!

The Surefire EDCL1-T is one of the best EDC Surefires of all time IMO. I was first exposed to Surefire through the LX2 Lumamax, which had the 2-stage 'gas pedal' switch that I loved, which light also has!
Thank you very much!

WRITING.TITLE: HDS Systems EDC Executive with Nichia 219A amp; other mods

WRITING.TEXT: HDS has always been one of my favourite brands... this one has a Nichia 219A LED (modded aftermarket), black plated stainless steel bezel, and a reflector which enables more throw than standard.
They are great lights - which do you have?
Wow! That's an awesome collection. I currently have two Nichia 219A modded EDC Executives.
Thanks haha, it's the cheapest option there is for HDS AFAIK. It's the standard Stainless Steel clip.
Very nice!! I haven't tried the Rotary design first hand yet, I need to give it a go...
Nice! They are great for EDC IMO. Only thing I've heard is the Rotary's 'Universal' clip option isn't that great...
Damn, that's a lot of throw for 115 lumens... ;)

WRITING.TITLE: 21M / Uni Student / UK / EDC (Seiko SKX009, HDS EDC Executive, Fenix E01)

WRITING.TEXT: My EDC: #128294; #8986; #128179; #128273; * **Main Flashlight**: HDS EDC Executive with Nichia 219A Mod * **Watch**: Seiko SKX009J with Strapcode Super Oyster Bracelet * **Keychain**: Fenix E01 gen 1 (backup light), orange paracord * **Wallet** \- M amp;S Faux Leather Card Holder (held up very well) with Pocket Ninja card multitool #128512; #128077;
Ideally I really want to do this, how risky is it though re. breaking the clip?
Fair enough. Well, if I give the Rotary a shot I'm sure I'll check the clip out too because a pocket clip is a must have for me!
Thanks! :)
I've broken clips before by trying to adjust the tension (Surefire) so it makes me nervous, but I may give it a shot at some point!
Thank you very much, I'm glad you like it!
They're awesome flashlights!
Awesome! Great idea :)

WRITING.TITLE: Surefire Z2 Combatlight used in Iraq War (see comments)
